history.content: It won't count towards your GPA. And besides, intentionally taking a more basic course when you've taken an advanced course just to boost your GPA is not only taking resources away from students who need them but also gaming the system, which is definitely not advised.

I'm currently in the College of Engineering and trying to switch into EECS. I understand all the requirements, but I'm trying to raise my engineering technical GPA to a 3.3. Let's say I supposedly take CS 10 to boost my GPA (I've already taken 61A and 61B). I asked my counselor, and she said that the class would count towards my technical GPA to switch. However, on Berkeley's CS10 website, it says "Credit Restrictions: Students will receive no credit for 10 after having taken W10, 61A, 61B, or 61C." 

Does this mean that it won't count toward my GPA? I'm planning to ask my counselor again, but I wanted a 2nd person's input.
history.subject: Do "no-credit" classes count toward technical GPA?
